intro: Pombalia attenuata, commonly known as the slender pombalia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Pombalia attenuata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
